FuncDef: The reset cpu-defend vlan-host-car statistics command clears statistics about packets controlled by VLAN-Host-CAR.
CLIs: reset cpu-defend vlan-host-car { <car-id> | all | auto-adjust | dropped | non-dropped } statistics slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Clears statistics about packets controlled by a VLAN-Host-CAR rule with a specified CAR ID.
The value is an integer in the range 0 to 4095.

Clears statistics about all packets controlled by VLAN-Host-CAR.
-

Clears the IDs of CAR rules in which the bandwidth values are automatically adjusted.
-

Clears statistics about packets in which some bytes are dropped.
-

Clears statistics in which the passed packet traffic is not 0 and the discarded packet traffic is 0.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the CAR ID parameter is specified, the command clears statistics about the packets controlled by a VLAN-Host-CAR rule with a specified CAR ID. If the all parameters are specified, the command clears statistics about all packets.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
